intro: Dissotis sizenandoi var. brevipilosa, commonly known as the short-pilose dissotis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
